instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used in the related study to optimize the method for on-line detection of paddy moisture content (MC) during harvest?
Output: On-line near-infrared sensing system was used in the related study.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used in the related study to optimize the method for on-line detection of paddy moisture content (MC) during harvest?
Output: Ensemble preprocessing methods, including competitive adaptive reweighted sampling (CARS) and random frog (RG), were used in the related study to optimize the method for on-line detection of paddy moisture content (MC) during harvest.

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the performance of the MC detection method for paddy during harvest, and how far can this metric go in terms of accuracy?
Output: The metric chosen to evaluate the performance of the MC detection method for paddy during harvest is the root mean standard error of prediction (RMSEPV). The accuracy achieved by this metric is as low as 1.0791% w.b.

instruction: What machine learning algorithm was found to be the most effective in optimizing the on-line detection of paddy moisture content during harvest in the near-infrared sensing system?
Output: The machine learning algorithm that was found to be the most effective in optimizing the on-line detection of paddy moisture content during harvest in the near-infrared sensing system was extreme learning machine (ELM).

instruction: Can the optimized method using ELM coupled with OSC + SG be considered superior to traditional methods for on-line detection of paddy moisture content during harvest in the near-infrared sensing system?
Output: Yes, the optimized method using ELM coupled with OSC + SG can be considered superior to traditional methods for on-line detection of paddy moisture content during harvest in the near-infrared sensing system. The study mentioned that this method achieved the best result among all conditions tested, with a low root mean standard error of prediction (RMSEPV) of 1.0791% w.b. Additionally, stability tests showed that ELM had enough robustness to cope with complex detecting conditions and maintain proper accuracy. Therefore, this optimized method offers improved performance and accuracy compared to traditional methods for on-line detection of paddy moisture content during harvest.
